data.title: The Senior Center in Central Park, Huntington Beach California is a spectacular way to get involved with the senior citizen community. It offers services, classes, the Hoag Health & Wellness Pavilion
data.meta_description: The Senior Center in Central Park is a focal point for an array of programs and services important to the quality of life for the seniors in our community. The center is a multi-purpose facility and offers opportunities for involvement and companionship with a wide range of social, recreational and educational programs promoting wellness.
data.text:
The Summer SANDS

You can register for classes at the Senior Center online at hbsands.org or in person at the Senior Center. Check www.hbsands.org for class schedules and registration. The Hoag Health and Wellness Pavilion is currently open from 8am – 7pm, Mon – Thurs, 8am – 5pm, Friday and 8am – 12pm on Saturday. Social Services including transportation, home delivered meals, and care management are available.

Enter the Senior Center and you will notice a feeling of openness as light pours through the Grand Entry windows overlooking the park. Our friendly volunteers will make you feel at home as you are welcomed and provided class, activity, and event information. Regular visitors will receive a unique slide card that gives access to a computer where you will select the activities you plan to attend during your visit.

Services

The Senior Center in Central Park offers many services that address common issues that confront seniors in the community. These services provide much needed assistance on subjects ranging from healthcare to taxes.

Classes

Classes include a broad curriculum where adults and seniors can sharpen skills, have fun, get a workout, and exercise the mind. There are three classrooms and a game room, with free activities and classes along with courses offered through the City of Huntington Beach Computer and Library Services at hbsands.org.

Hoag Health and Wellness Pavilion

The Hoag Health and Wellness Pavilion is fully furnished with state-of-the-art user-friendly fitness equipment. Classes, appointments with personal trainers, or independent workout time are available. 714.374.1578

Activities And Clubs

The senior center is home to a variety of activities and clubs that cater to interests of all types. These social groups and events focus on recreation, crafts, and hobbies.

Information And Referral

Senior Services provides referrals to seniors & their families for services in Huntington Beach and the county. Information about a wide range of senior concerns such as housing, in home care, caregiver assistance is available. Call 714-374-1572.

Meals on Wheels Orange County (MOWOC) Lunch Program

Meals on Wheels provides a wide variety of delicious, nutritious lunches Monday, Wednesday and Friday at 11:30 AM. A donation of $3.00 per meal is suggested for those 60 years and older. For those under 60, the fee is $5.00. For more information, call (714) 536-8404.

Volunteer Services

Volunteers are essential to the success of our programs. In 2014, volunteers provided over 45,000 hours of service through driving, meal delivery, office assistance, teaching, cleaning, or just listening.

Sands Online Recreation Guide

You can sign up for SANDS email alerts at hbsands.org (email addresses will only be used for City of Huntington Beach information). All the information, schedules, and registration information and forms are available to you on line. Limited copies will be available at Community Centers, Libraries, Lifeguard Headquarters, and City Hall.
